result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren P. Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.   Sentence to commence within 60 days. Must report today for start date. - stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-81 and 15CF-66.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darren P. Krueger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darren P. Krueger in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-81, 15CF-66, 15CM-73 and 15CF-117.

1:46 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
15CF-66: State has filed an amended information, amending Count 1 to misdemeanor possession of THC, enhancer. 6 month jail, imposed/stayed, probation for 24 months, AODA and comply, abs sob as to alcohol and controlled substances other than prescribed medications, obt/mtn ft empt, other counseling, pay costs. Defendant will plead to this amended count. Defendant will also plead to Count 2, BAC: .147, 23 day jail sentence, $1,568.00, $33.33, 14 Mo revocation, 14 Mo IID, DOT assessment. Counts 3 and 4 would be dismissed and read in.

15CF-81: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in.
Count 1 and Count 3: 6 mo jail on each, imposed/stayed, concurrent to one another, consecutive to any other sentence, probation 24 months, same conditions, costs, DNA surcharge.  Count 4: 25 day jail sentence consecutive to 15CF-66.

15CM-73: Defendant will plead to single count as charged. State recommends 90 day jail sentence, imposed/stayed, consecutive to any other sentence, probation for 24 months, same general conditions, costs.

15CF-117: State recommends this case be dismissed and read in

Atty Sheets concurs.
Atty Sheets has received a copy of the amended information.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF-66: Count 1 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-66: Count 2 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-81: Count 1 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-81: Count 3 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-81: Count 4 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-73: Count 1 NO CONTEST


Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-66: Count 1: 961.41(3g)(3)   939.62(1)(a)
15CF-66: Count 2: 346.63(1)(a)  Defendant ackknowledges previous conviction
15CF-66: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-66: Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-81: Count 1: 961.573(1)  939.62(1)(a)
15CF-81: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-81: Count 3: 946.49(1)(a)  939.62(1)(a)
15CF-81: Count 4: 943.44(1)(b)
15CM-73: Count 1:  961.573(1)   939.62(1)(a)
15CF-117: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
$500 cash bond on 15CF-117 to be applied to fines/costs. $500 cash bond in 15CF-81 to be applied to fines/costs.
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant works at Golden County Foods. Atty Sheets requests electronic monitoring.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-66:

Count 1:
Jail sentence for 6 Months, imposed and stayed
Huber is granted.
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations made for treatment
Assessor can make use of any work done in that part. Defendant to sign releases
Maintain absolute sobriety as to alcohol and controlled substances other than prescribed medications
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent reasonable to this case
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2:
Jail sentence for 23 Days
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
Huber is granted.
Pay a fine and costs totaling $1,568.00
Pay blood draw fee of $33.33
Drivers License Revoked 14 Months
IID 14 Months 
AODA Assessment  and comply with treatment recommendations BAC: .147

15CF-81: 

Count 1:
Jail sentence for 6 Months, imposed and stayed
Huber is granted.
Consecutive to any other sentence
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-66
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 6 Months, imposed and stayed
Huber is granted.
Concurrent to Count 1
Consecutive to any other sentence
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and 15CF-66
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Jail sentence for 25 Days
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
Huber is granted.
Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 3
Consecutive to OWI but may be on electronic monitor

15CM-73:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 6 months, imposed and stayed
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
Huber is granted.
Probation for a period of 24 
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-81 and 15CF-66
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

$500 cash bond in 15CF-117 to be applied to fines/costs in the other files.
$500 cash bond in 15CF-81 to be applied to fines/costs.

Status heard with 15CF66 and 15CF81.
Matter set for PTC to track.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on April 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Darren P. Krueger in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-66 and 15CM-73.

9:13 AM Court calls cases and states appearances.

Court informs Defendant of charges.
Atty Sheets received a copy of the complaints, waives reading, waives time limits.

Atty Knaapen states bond was previously set.

Defendant enters NOT GUILTY pleas.

BY THE COURT:
Bond continued.
Bond in 15CF-66 covers 15CM-73 as of today's date.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
for Attorney Fees: Atty Sheets appointed: Defendant to pay $100 per pay period (apply payments to case #15CF66)

Defendant Darren P. Krueger in court. 
Cases heard today are 15CF66 and 15CM73.
These cases are set for an Indigency Hearing.

10:21 a.m.  Court calls case.
Darren P Krueger is sworn in.
Court questions the defendant.
Court reviews the cases to determine charges.
Defendant had gone to the Public Defender and was denied their services.
Court questions the defendant regarding his employment at Golden County Foods.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is found to be partially indigent.
Wage assignment to be set in the amount of $100 per paycheck (paid bi-weekly).
Atty Sheets is aked if he could be the court appointed attorney and Atty Sheets agree's to this.

Bond covers both files 15CF-66 and 15CM-73.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Comply with all restrictions on drivers license.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Darren P. Krueger in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-66 and 15CM-73.

9:17 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Defendant appear without counsel.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant has received copies of the complaints.

Defendant understands the penalties and charges.

Defendant waives reading of complaints.

Court advises Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.

Matters will be continued for Defendant to get an attorney.

State addresses bond.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
